page.title: 12Ecology : Nature Reserve
page.content: ECOLOGY:Nature Reserve:Birds Breeding Birds:the following birds are known to breed on the reserve:Ringed Plover,Skylark,Reed Bunting,Partridge,Mallard, Meadow Pipits and Lapwing. Non- breeeding species:a large number of species of water birds, especially diving duck, visit the pools.The thinly vegetated areas are roosting grounds for gulls,terns and waders.During very cold winters the pools attract many varieties of duck, in particular Pochard,Tufted and Red- breasted Mergansers. Many ringed plovers roost on the causeway as do Turnstones,and Purple Sandpipers.Scarce waders include Little Stint,Curlew Sandpiper,Kentish Plover,Woodcock,Blacktailed Godwit and Grey Phalarope.Seaforth is now 1 of top 3 areas in Britain for Little Gull
